description.narrative: Advance global thinking and knowledge sharing on inclusive and sustainable development in drylands and other fragile ecosystems

description.narrative:
1.1 - Number of knowledge products produced on the sustainable management of natural capital in support of jobs and livelihoods
1.2 - Number of initiatives supported to improve or mainstream the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems
1.3 - Number of major events, and forums supported on the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems
2.1 - Number of knowledge products produced on socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems, in collaboration with partners
2.2 - Number of initiatives supported to mainstream policies to enhance socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems
2.3 - Number of initiatives supported to restore socio-ecological resilience in communities emerging from crisis and to promote economic revitalization, job creation and environmentally sustainable livelihoods for affected men and women
2.4 - Number of major events, and forums supported on the challenges of socio-ecological resilience in drylands and fragile ecosystems
3.1 - Number of networks operational and strengthened on sustainable management and resilience building practices
4.1 - Number of knowledge products produced on the poverty/environment nexus
4.2 - Number of countries where the tools developed are tested and validated
4.3 - Number of forums facilitated to introduce the tools developed

comment.narrative: 1.1 - Knowledge products on the sustainable management of natural capital: 3 1.2 - Initiatives supported to improve or mainstream the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 5 1.3 - Major events, and forums supported on the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems : 5 2.1 - Knowledge products produced on socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 5 2.2 - Initiatives supported to mainstream policies to enhance socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems : 5 2.3 - Initiatives supported to restore socio-ecological resilience in communities emerging from crisis and to promote economic revitalization, job creation and environmentally sustainable livelihoods for affected men and women: 0 2.4 - Major events and forums supported on the challenges of socio-ecological resilience in drylands and fragile ecosystems: 6 3.1 - Networks operational and strengthened on sustainable management and resilience building practices: 3 4.1 - Knowledge products produced on the poverty/environment nexus: 2 4.2 - Countries where the tools developed are tested and validated : 3 4.3 - Forums facilitated to introduce the tools developed: 0

Output targets for 2019 include: 1.1. Number of knowledge products produced on the sustainable management of natural capital in support of jobs and livelihoods: 3 1.2. Number of initiatives supported to improve or mainstream the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: Complete on-going initiatives (4) + 1 new itiative 1.3. Number of major events, and forums supported on the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 6 2.1. Number of knowledge products produced on socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems, in collaboration with partners: 0 2.2 - Number of initiatives supported to mainstream policies to enhance socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: Complete on-going initiatives (3) 2.3 Number of initiatives supported to restore resilience in crisis affected countries: 0 2.4. Number of major events, and forums supported on the challenges of socio-ecological resilience in drylands and fragile ecosystems: 2 3.1. Number of networks operational and strengthened on sustainable management and resilience building practices: 1 4.1. Number of knowledge products produced on the poverty/environment nexus: 0 4.2. Number of countries where the tools developed are tested and validated: 0 4.3. Number of forums facilitated to introduce the tools developed: 1

1.1 UNDP position paper for UNCCD/COP14 titled “Combatting Land Degradation – Securing a Sustainable Future”. Joint UNDP/UNCCD/IUCN publication on gender mainstreaming in Land Degradation Neutrality (LDN) implementation titled “Land Degradation Neutrality – Interventions to Foster Gender Equality”. Technical paper titled “Future Perspectives on Land for Eastern Africa”. 1.2 Supported LDN implementation in 3 countries: Somalia (target setting); Lebanon (capacity building in forestry, agriculture and land-use planning sectors) and Kenya (target setting. Pursued support to the implementation of the UNCCD Gender Action Plan (training for country parties at UNCCD/COP14 in New Delhi; support to the review of COP14 decisions on Drought and Sand and Dust Storms from a gender perspective. Completed the study on the Economics of Land Degradation in Somalia. 1.3 Supported UNDP’s engagement in the following major events/forums: UNCCD/CRIC17; IPBES-7; UNEA-4; UNCCD/COOP14; SG’s Climate Summit; and Poverty-Environment Partnership (PEP) Meeting. 2.1 Activity completed. 2.2 Provided technical support for the preparation of the National Drought Action Plans for Iran and Morocco. Represented UNDP and provided substantive input to the implementation of the Integrated Drought Management Programme. 2.3 Activity completed 2.4 Represented UNDP in the conference Beating Famine in the Sahel and contributed to the working group on “Land Restoration for Resilience Building, Climate Change Adaptation and Drought Management”. Chaired side event at UNCCD/COP14 to support the review the proposed and anticipated COP decisions on Drought and Sand and Dust Storms from a gender perspective. 3,1 Provided technical support on Sustainable Land Management to the Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services Network (BES-Net) 4.1 Activity completed 4.2 The GC-RED Director continued her role co-director of the Poverty Environment Action for SDG Programme (PEA), implemented jointly with UNEP. Provided technical support to programme countries on mainstreaming poverty-environment-climate considerations in to national planning and budgeting frameworks. 4.3 Poverty-Environment Handbook and Compendium introduced at relevant events in PEA programme countries

Output targets for 2020 include: • 1.1. Number of knowledge products produced on the sustainable management of natural capital in support of jobs and livelihoods: 2 (initiated in 2020 and will be completed in 2021) • 1.2. Number of initiatives supported to improve or mainstream the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 2 • 1.3. Number of major events, and forums supported on the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 0 • 2.1. Number of knowledge products produced on socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems, in collaboration with partners: 0 • 2.2 - Number of initiatives supported to mainstream policies to enhance socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: Pursue on-going initiatives (2). No new initiatives. • 2.3 Number of initiatives supported to restore resilience in crisis affected countries: 0 • 2.4. Number of major events, and forums supported on the challenges of socio-ecological resilience in drylands and fragile ecosystems: 0 • 3.1. Number of networks operational and strengthened on sustainable management and resilience building practices: Pursue support to BES-Net. No new initiatives. • 4.1. Number of knowledge products produced on the poverty/environment nexus: 0 • 4.2. Number of countries where the tools developed are tested and validated: 5 • 4.3. Number of forums facilitated to introduce the tools developed: 3

1.1: “Future Perspectives on Land for Eastern Africa”: The technical workshops, in Nairobi and Addis Ababa, were cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic and replaced by an Online Working Group (OWG). Significant progress achieved in 2020: 4 sessions of OWG organized; completion of scenario analyses; and first draft of policy report completed in December. Finalization and publication of report in Q2/2021. “Global Land Outlook – Second Edition GLO2”: Consensus on the storyline and thematic elements reached. Thematic papers prepared. Final draft to be completed by June 2021. Official launch at UNCCD/COP15 in Dec. 2021. 1.2: “Climate Promise”: Technical support provided for the review of the NDCs in Somalia and Kenya. NDC review process, including alignment of climate and land targets, is on track in Somalia; submission of final report to UNFCC in Q1/2021. Process delayed in Kenya due to the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, but efforts have now resumed to complete the review by March 2021. “UN Decade on Ecosystem Restoration (2021-2030)”: Supported UNDP’s engagement in the preparatory phase of this initiative. Decade’s Strategy and Communication Strategy approved. 1.3: Major events cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic 2.1: Activity completed. 2.2: “UN Coalition to Combat Sand and Dust Storms (SDS)”: Represented UNDP in Coalition, including co-leading with FAO and UNCCD the Adaptation & Mitigation working group. Strategy and Action Plan of Coalition approved. Priority activities of working group initiated, including development of SDS Toolbox to be launched at UNCCD/COP15 in Dec 2021. “Integrated Drought Management Programme”: Represented UNDP in Advisory Board and reviewed two knowledge products prepared by the programme (Drought and Water Scarcity; Integrated Drought Management Framework). 2.3: Activity completed 2.4: Activity completed 3.1: Pursued Centre’s support to the Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services Network (BES-Net). See detailed reporting under the BES-Net output. 4.1: Activity completed 4.2: 1 country adopted Poverty-Environment Action tools/approaches resulting from South-South knowledge collaboration i.e. South Africa on Green Bonds 4.3: No forums held specifically to facilitate introduction of the tools due to COVID pandemic but an increase in advocacy and coordination efforts registered with development partners engaged in supporting SDG implementation to mainstream the use of Poverty-Environment Action integrated approaches and tools in their programmes and to ensure synergies with similar projects.

Output targets for 2018 include: 1.1. Number of knowledge products produced on the sustainable management of natural capital in support of jobs and livelihoods: 2 1.2. Number of initiatives supported to improve or mainstream the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 4 1.3. Number of major events, and forums supported on the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 4 2.1. Number of knowledge products produced on socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems, in collaboration with partners: 1 2.2 - Number of initiatives supported to mainstream policies to enhance socio-ecological resilience in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: 3 2.3 Number of initiatives supported to restore resilience in crisis affected countries: 2 2.4. Number of major events, and forums supported on the challenges of socio-ecological resilience in drylands and fragile ecosystems: 3 3.1. Number of networks operational and strengthened on sustainable management and resilience building practices: 3 4.1. Number of knowledge products produced on the poverty/environment nexus: 4 4.2. Number of countries where the tools developed are tested and validated: 5 4.3. Number of forums facilitated to introduce the tools developed: 2

The 2018 achievements can be summarized as follows: 1.1 “Framework for Scaling Sustainable Land Management Options” developed in partnership with UNCCD, ICARDA, others and published in the international scientific journal “Land Degradation and Development”. “Exploring Future Changes in Land Use and Land Condition in Eastern Africa” – paper prepared jointly with the Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency (PBL) and the Joint Research Centre of the European Commission, for submission to the African Initiative for Combating Desertification. 1.2 Initiatives supported in 2018, namely: UNCCD Gender Action Plan; Land Degradation Neutrality Target Setting in Somalia; Land Degradation Neutrality Implementation in Lebanon; Economics of Land Degradation in Somalia; Land Degradation Neutrality Implementation in Kenya 1.3 Events & forums supported: Scoping meeting for the second edition of the Global Land Outlook; Capacity building workshop on the UNCCD/LDN Reporting Framework; Annual Poverty Environment Partnership meeting; Sixth plenary session of the Intergovernmental Panel on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services (IPBES-6) 2.1 Knowledge products on socio-ecological resilience: Guidelines for Mainstreaming Gender into National Drought Action Plans 2.2 Initiatives supported in 2018: Drought Action Plan for Iran; Drought Action Plan for Morocco; Drought Action Plan for Somalia. 2.3 Initiatives supported in 2018: Resilient Recovery and SDG Implementation in Syria 2.4 Events and forums supported: UNCCD Drought Initiative Workshop; SADC Workshop on Vulnerability Assessment and Analysis Frameworks; Integrated Drought Management Programme (IDMP) Advisory Meeting. 3.1 Networks operational and strengthened: Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services Network (BES-Net); Africa Asia Drought Risk Management Peer Assistance Network (AADP) 4.1 Knowledge products on poverty-environment nexus: P-E Handbook in Arabic; Compendium of Tools, Experiences and Results on P-E Mainstreaming; P-E Mainstreaming Lessons Learnt; Guidance Document on Integrating ENR in Multi-Dimension Poverty 4.2 Technical and capacity building support to mainstream poverty-environment considerations in national planning and budgeting processes (Burkina Faso, Malawi, Mali, Mauritania, Mozambique, Rwanda and Tanzania) 4.3 Forums supported to introduce P-E tools: Arab Forum on Sustainable Development; ENR/MPI Workshop

1.1 - Number of knowledge products produced on the sustainable management of natural capital in support of jobs and livelihoods: 1 1.2 - Number of initiatives supported to improve or mainstream the sustainable management of natural capital in drylands and other fragile ecosystems: Pursue on-going initiatives (2). No new initiatives. 4.1 - Number of knowledge products produced on the poverty/environment nexus: 0 (Activity Completed). 4.2 - Number of countries where the tools developed are tested and validated: 7 4.3 - Number of forums facilitated to introduce the tools developed: 7
